item.title: Derived Distributions
item.description:
$
ewcommand{ r}{\}$ $
ewcommand{\R}{\mathbb{R}}$ $

ewcommand{\Z}{\mathbb{Z}}$ $
ewcommand{\N}{\mathbb{N}}$ $
ewcommand{\C}{\mathbb{C}}$ $
ewcommand{\P}{\mathbb{P}}$ $
ewcommand{\F}{\mathbb{F}}$ $
ewcommand{\L}{\mathcal{L}}$ $
ewcommand{\spa}[1]{	ext{span}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{\dist}[1]{	ext{dist}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{\max}[1]{	ext{max}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{\min}[1]{	ext{min}(#1)}$ $

ewcommand{\argmin}[1]{\underset{#1}{	ext{argmin }}}$ $

orm}[1]{\left\lVert#1ightVert}$ $

ewcommand{	ail}{	ext T}$ $

ewcommand{\inner}[2]{\langle #1, #2 angle}$ $

ullity}[1]{	ext{nullity}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{ank}[1]{	ext{rank }#1}$ $
ewcommand{
ullspace}[1]{\mathcal{N}\pare{#1}}$ $

ewcommand{\ot}{	ext{ onto }}$ $

ewcommand{\Im}[1]{	ext{Im}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{\dom}[1]{	ext{dom}(#1)}$ $
ewcommand{ next}[1]{\overset{\sim}{#1}}$ $
ewcommand{	ranspose}[1]{{#1}^{	ext{T}}}$ $
ewcommand{ }[1]{ oldsymbol{#1}}$ $
ewcommand{\None}[1]{}$ $
ewcommand{\Vcw}[2]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Vce}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Vcr}[4]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Vct}[5]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Vcy}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5  r #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Vcu}[7]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5  r #6  r #7 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vcw}[2]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vce}[3]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2  r #3 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vcr}[4]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vct}[5]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vcy}[6]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5  r #6 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\vcu}[7]{ egin{matrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5  r #6  r #7 \end{matrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqw}[2]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqe}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqr}[4]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 & #4 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqt}[5]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 & #4 & #5 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mwq}[2]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Meq}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mrq}[4]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mtq}[5]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3  r #4  r #5 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqw}[2]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mwq}[2]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mww}[4]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2  r #3 & #4 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mqe}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Meq}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mwe}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 r #4 & #5 & #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mew}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2  r #3 & #4  r #5 & #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mee}[9]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3  r #4 & #5 & #6  r #7 & #8 & #9 \end{bmatrix}}$ Definition: Derived Distribution Let $X$ be a continuous random variable with PDF $f_X(x) : \R 	o [0, +\infty)$, and $g: \R 	o \R$ be a function.

ewcommand{\Mee}[9]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3  r #4 & #5 & #6  r #7 & #8 & #9 \end{bmatrix}}$ Definition: Covariance Let $X$ and $Y$ be two random variable.

ewcommand{\Meq}[3]{ egin{bmatrix} #1  r #2  r #3 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mwe}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3 r #4 & #5 & #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mew}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2  r #3 & #4  r #5 & #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mee}[9]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3  r #4 & #5 & #6  r #7 & #8 & #9 \end{bmatrix}}$ Definition: The Expected Value of $X$ Given $Y=y$ Let $X$, $Y$ be two random variables, $E[ X | Y = y]$ is a function of $y$, $E[ X|Y ] $ is a function of $Y$.

ewcommand{\Mew}[6]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2  r #3 & #4  r #5 & #6 \end{bmatrix}}$ $
ewcommand{\Mee}[9]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3  r #4 & #5 & #6  r #7 & #8 & #9 \end{bmatrix}}$ Definition: Moment Generating Function (MGF) Let $X$ be a random variable, we define the moment generating function (or transform) of $X$ to be the function $M_X: \R 	o \R $ such that

ewcommand{\Mee}[9]{ egin{bmatrix} #1 & #2 & #3  r #4 & #5 & #6  r #7 & #8 & #9 \end{bmatrix}}$ Theorem : Expectation and Variance of the Sum of a Random Number of Independent Random Variables Consider the sum, where $N$ is a random variable that takes nonnegative integer values, and $X_1, X_2, …, X_n$ are identically distributed random variables.
